Message.Title: KO's ballooning debt
Message.Msg: Over the last five years, the Coca-Cola company's long-term and short-term debt load has ballooned. I really don't like this in the company. Also, looking at the last five years of cash flow statements - particularly the financing cash flow sections - I don't like the fact the company issue debt to cover its dividend payments and share buybacks. I want to see those things covered using the company's free cash flow - and not by new debt issuance.

Topic.Title: TIME for a new 52 week high in Coca Cola

Message.Msg: Well, I know after just buying Heinz, Buffet said he and Munger are putting back on their big game hunting outfits to look for more trophies. However, with Coke having an enterprise value of about $195 billion, I don't think it will be the one. Remember, enterprise value factors in debt and cash, while market cap does not.
